headline: PG&E and Smart Wires Enhance Grid Reliability, Capacity for Data Centers in San Jose
summary: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) and Smart Wires today announced a new project to enhance grid reliability and meet energy commitments for data centers connecting in San Jose. By deploying its cutting-edge advanced power flow control (APFC) technology, Smart Wires will help PG&E mitigate thermal overloads, redirect power flow, and increase available capacity at its Los Esteros electric substation.

content.title: PG&E and Smart Wires Enhance Grid Reliability, Capacity for Data Centers in San Jose
content.summary: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) and Smart Wires today announced a new project to enhance grid reliability and meet energy commitments for data centers connecting in San Jose. By deploying its cutting-edge advanced power flow control (APFC) technology, Smart Wires will help PG&E mitigate thermal overloads, redirect power flow, and increase available capacity at its Los Esteros electric substation.

thumbnail.caption: PG&E is deploying an advanced power flow control technology at its Los Esteros electric substation in San Jose. The installation of North Carolina-based Smart Wires' SmartValve will boost capacity by more than 100 megawatts (MW) at the substation, which is located adjacent to new data centers under development in the Alviso community of San Jose.
